bylaw.name: Township of Langley Small-Scale Multi-Unit Housing Bylaw No. 6020
bylaw.purpose: Amendments to Zoning Bylaw 1987 No. 2500 to incorporate small-scale multi-unit housing per Bill 44

referenceBylaws.zoningBylaw: Township of Langley Zoning Bylaw 1987 No. 2500
referenceBylaws.subdivisonAndDevelopment: Subdivision and Development Servicing Bylaw 2019 No. 5382
referenceBylaws.transitOrientedArea: Willowbrook Transit-Oriented Area Designation Bylaw No. 6021

footnoteChanges.R2Removed: Deleted '557.4 m², or 18.3 m, 25 m' and associated footnotes
footnoteChanges.CD196: Added footnote (7) 'For single family or small-scale, multi-unit housing developments'

subdivisionExemption.condition: If the accessory building is an accessory dwelling unit that meets the requirements of the Zoning Bylaw for a principal residential use on the newly created lot

smallScaleMultiUnitHousing.definition: Up to four dwelling units (attached or detached) on a single lot

requiredConditions.condition: Must be located within urban containment boundary
Must be serviced with municipal sanitary sewer
Must be serviced with municipal water system
Must not have heritage designation protection from before Dec 7, 2023
Must not be in Willowbrook Transit-Oriented Area (Bylaw No. 6021)

singleFamilyDwelling.definition: A detached dwelling unit and up to one secondary suite

twoFamilyDwelling.definition: A building with two principal dwelling units joined by common wall

infillHousing.definition: One or more detached dwelling units on a lot with one retained dwelling
infillHousing.retainedDwellingRequirement: Must be constructed before adoption of Bylaw No. 6020

accessoryDwellingUnit.definition: A dwelling unit within an accessory building
accessoryDwellingUnit.allowedWhen: Single family dwelling does not include a secondary suite

coachHouse.definition: An accessory dwelling unit located in second storey of detached garage

conditions.condition: Lot contains at least three dwelling units
Street abutting side lot line is local street or lane
Sum of all driveway widths on lot not more than 12 metres

locations.coordinationRequired: Driveway locations shall be co-ordinated to maximize on-street parking and street tree siting
locations.referenceBylaw: Subdivision and Development Servicing Bylaw 2019 No. 5382 as amended

parkingLocationRequirements: All parking spaces must be located in rear yard with access from a lane
No parking spaces shall directly access a highway other than a lane

frontLoadedCornerLot.parkingNotAllowed: No part of a parking space shall project in the triangular area created by a line joining two points measured at 7.0 metres from the projected lot lines abutting a street or lane

rearLoadedCornerLot.parkingNotAllowed: No part of a parking space shall project in the triangular area created by a line joining two points measured at 2.5 metres from the projected lot lines abutting a street and/or a lane

tandemParking.note: Definition amended by deleting the words 'in a garage or carport'

setbacks.explanation: Minimum distances buildings must be placed from property lines

cornerLotSightTriangle.explanation: On corner lots, no part of any building, structure or fence greater than 1 metre in height shall project into a triangular area

projectingFeatures.explanation: Access stairs, porches, verandahs and balconies may reduce setbacks

conditions: Only applies to stairs providing access to rear yard from first storey
Stair landing area not to exceed 1.5 square metres

partyWallProvision.explanation: On abutting lots, interior side lot line setback for accessory detached garages may be reduced
conditions: Two garages abutting one another must be simultaneously designed
Building permits must be issued together
Garages must be constructed by same builder using party wall agreement
Eave and gutter must be setback minimum 0.45m or 0.3m from interior side lot line depending on zone

parallelStreets.explanation: Where a lot fronts onto two parallel streets besides a lane
parallelStreets.rearLotLineSetback: Same as front lot line setback

sideInteriorLotLine.note: May be reduced to 0 with party wall agreement

sideInteriorOrLocalStreet.note: May be reduced to 0 with party wall agreement

heightRestrictions.explanation: Maximum allowable height for different building types

infillHousingNearRearLotLine.applicability: Within 6 metres of rear lot line, except coach houses fronting a lane

conditions: Where gross floor area of a single family dwelling is 280m² or greater
Includes all attached and detached garages/carports
grossFloorAreaOver280m2.maxHeight: Two storeys plus a basement where permitted

secondStoreyRestriction.units: percent of first storey gross floor area (including garages/carports)

lotCoverage.explanation: Maximum percentage of lot area that can be covered by buildings and structures

thirdStoreyRestrictions.explanation: Restrictions on third storey floor area based on number of dwelling units on lot

oneOrTwoDwellingUnits.units: percent of first storey floor area

threeDwellingUnits.units: percent of first storey floor area

fourDwellingUnits.units: percent of first storey floor area

compactLotZones.explanation: Special provisions for compact lot zones (R-CL)

densityLimits.exception: May be exceeded when single family dwellings are replaced with small-scale multi-unit housing

checkEligibility: Verify lot is within urban containment boundary
Verify lot area is less than 4,050 m²
Verify lot has municipal sanitary sewer and water services
Verify lot has no heritage designation protection from before Dec 7, 2023
Verify lot is not in Willowbrook Transit-Oriented Area
If lot area ≤ 280 m², maximum 3 dwelling units; otherwise maximum 4 dwelling units
checkSetbacks: Determine if lot is front-loaded or rear-loaded
Apply appropriate setbacks based on building type, lot configuration, and zone
If corner lot, apply sight triangle restrictions
If accessory structure <6m², apply reduced setbacks
If abutting lots with accessory garages, check party wall agreement provisions
If lot fronts two parallel streets, rear setback equals front setback
Check for projecting features (stairs, porches, verandahs, balconies) and apply reduced setbacks if applicable
checkHeight: Apply 4.5m height limit to infill housing near rear lot line
Apply 9.0m height limit to all other dwelling units
Apply 3.75m height limit to accessory structures that are not dwelling units
checkLotCoverage: If infill housing is present, may increase to 45%
For compact lot zones with area <372m², apply 55% coverage limit with 150m² max single family dwelling footprint
For compact lot zones with area ≥372m², apply 40% standard coverage or 45% with infill housing
checkThirdStorey: If 1-2 dwelling units: third storey not permitted
If 3 dwelling units: third storey max 50% of first storey area
If 4 dwelling units: third storey max 80% of first storey area
checkParking: If in Transit-Oriented Area, check exemption for residential parking
For corner lots with ≥3 units, up to 2 additional driveways from side lot line if conditions met
For rear-loaded lots, all parking must be in rear yard with access from lane only
Check sight triangle restrictions for parking spaces on corner lots
Verify driveway locations are coordinated for on-street parking and street trees
Parking spaces may extend into municipal dedication but not beyond back of sidewalk/lane
checkSpecialZoneProvisions: For CD (Comprehensive Development) zones, check specific provisions that may allow SSMUH
For SR (Suburban Residential) zones, check if outside urban containment boundary
For R-CL (Residential Compact Lot) zones, apply specific density and coverage requirements
checkAccessoryDwellingUnits: Ensure single family dwelling does not include a secondary suite if there's an accessory dwelling unit
For coach houses, verify located only in second storey of detached garage

options: One small-scale multi-unit housing development
One single family dwelling plus one accessory dwelling unit (without secondary suite)
One single family dwelling or mobile home
One accessory dwelling unit if outside urban containment boundary and no secondary suite
One small-scale multi-unit housing development
One single family dwelling plus one accessory dwelling unit (without secondary suite)
One single family dwelling plus one accessory dwelling unit (without secondary suite)
One small-scale multi-unit housing development
One single family dwelling plus one accessory dwelling unit (without secondary suite)
One small-scale multi-unit housing development
One single family dwelling plus one accessory dwelling unit (without secondary suite)
One small-scale multi-unit housing development
One two family dwelling
One single family dwelling plus one accessory dwelling unit (without secondary suite)
One small-scale multi-unit housing development
One single family dwelling plus one accessory dwelling unit (without secondary suite)

exceptions: May be exceeded where single family dwellings are replaced with SSMUH
In Southwest Gordon, Routley and Yorkson Neighbourhood Plan areas, density shall be in accordance with Willoughby Community Plan

R_CLA.densityCompliance: Maximum density shall comply with Community or Neighbourhood Plan
options: One small-scale multi-unit housing development
One single family dwelling plus one accessory dwelling unit (without secondary suite)

R_CLB.densityCompliance: Maximum density shall comply with Community or Neighbourhood Plan
options: One small-scale multi-unit housing development
One single family dwelling plus one accessory dwelling unit (without secondary suite)

R_CLCH.explanation: Residential Compact Lot Coach House Zone
R_CLCH.densityCompliance: Maximum density shall comply with Community or Neighbourhood Plan
options: One small-scale multi-unit housing development
One single family dwelling and one coach house

CD-7.exception: Density may be exceeded for small-scale multi-unit housing development

CD-20.maxDensity: 24.7 units per ha/10 units per acre plus 6 additional units
CD-20.exception: Density may be exceeded for small-scale multi-unit housing development

CD-21.maxDensity: 29.7 units per ha/12 units per acre
CD-21.exception: Density may be exceeded for small-scale multi-unit housing development

CD-73.maxDensity: 87 units per hectare (35 units per acre)
CD-73.exception: Density may be exceeded for small-scale multi-unit housing development

CD-127.specificAllocation: 82 apartments and 5 small-scale multi-unit housing developments
